verses.verse: Then there arose a great<WH1419> cry<WH6818> of the people<WH5971> and of their wives<WH802> against their brothers<WH251> the Jews.<WH3064>
For there were<WH3426> that said,<WH559> "We,<WH1121> our sons and our daughters,<WH1323> are many.<WH7227> Let us get<WH3947> grain,<WH1715> that we may eat<WH398> and live.<WH2421>"

Some also there were<WH3426> that said,<WH559> "We are mortgaging<WH6148> our fields,<WH7704> and our vineyards,<WH3754> and our houses.<WH1004> Let us get<WH3947> grain,<WH1715> because of the famine.<WH7458>"
There were<WH3426> also some who said,<WH559> "We have borrowed<WH3867> money<WH3701> for the king<WH4428>'s tribute<WH4060> using our fields<WH7704> and our vineyards as collateral.<WH3754>

Yet now our flesh<WH1320> is as the flesh<WH1320> of our brothers,<WH251> our children<WH1121> as their children.<WH1121> Behold,<WH3533> we bring into bondage our sons<WH1121> and our daughters<WH1323> to be servants,<WH5650> and some of our daughters<WH1323> have been<WH3426> brought into bondage.<WH3533> Neither is it in our power<WH410> to help it;<WH312> for other men have our fields<WH7704> and our vineyards.<WH3754>"
I was very<WH3966> angry<WH2734> when I heard<WH8085> their cry<WH2201> and these words.<WH1697>

Then I consulted<WH4427> with myself,<WH3820> and contended<WH7378> with the nobles<WH2715> and the rulers,<WH5461> and said<WH559> to them,<WH5383> "You exact usury,<WH4855> everyone<WH376> of his brother.<WH251>" I held<WH5414> a great<WH1419> assembly against them.<WH6952>

I said<WH559> to them,<WH1767> "We, after our ability, have redeemed<WH7069> our brothers<WH251> the Jews<WH3064> that were sold<WH4376> to the nations;<WH1471> and would you even sell<WH4376> your brothers,<WH251> and should they be sold<WH4376> to us?<WH2790>" Then they held their peace, and found<WH4672> never a word.<WH1697>

Also I said,<WH559> "The thing that<WH1697> you do<WH6213> is not good.<WH2896> Ought you not to walk<WH3212> in the fear<WH3374> of our God,<WH430> because of the reproach<WH2781> of the nations<WH1471> our enemies?<WH341>
I likewise,<WH251> my brothers and my servants,<WH5288> lend<WH5383> them money<WH3701> and grain.<WH1715> Please let us stop<WH5800> this usury.<WH4855>

Please restore<WH7725> to them,<WH3117> even this day, their fields,<WH7704> their vineyards,<WH3754> their olive<WH2132> groves,<WH1004> and their houses, also the hundredth<WH3967> part of the money,<WH3701> and of the grain,<WH1715> the new wine,<WH8492> and the oil,<WH3323> that you are charging them.<WH5383>"

Then they said,<WH559> "We will restore<WH7725> them,<WH1245> and will require nothing of them;<WH6213> so will we do, even as you say.<WH559>" Then I called<WH7121> the priests,<WH3548> and took an oath<WH7650> of them,<WH6213> that they would do according to this promise.<WH1697>

Also I shook<WH5287> out my lap,<WH2684> and said,<WH559> "So may God<WH430> shake out<WH5287> every man<WH376> from his house,<WH1004> and from his labor,<WH3018> that doesn't<WH6965> perform this promise;<WH1697> even thus be he shaken out,<WH5287> and emptied.<WH7386>" All the assembly<WH6951> said,<WH559> "Amen,<WH543>" and praised<WH1984> Yahweh.<WH3068> The people<WH5971> did<WH6213> according to this promise.<WH1697>

Moreover from the time<WH3117> that I was appointed<WH6680> to be their governor<WH6346> in the land<WH776> of Judah,<WH3063> from the twentieth<WH6242> year<WH8141> even to the two<WH8147> and thirtieth<WH7970> year<WH8141> of Artaxerxes<WH783> the king,<WH4428> that is,<WH8147> twelve years,<WH8141> I and my brothers<WH251> have not eaten<WH398> the bread<WH3899> of the governor.<WH6346>

But the former<WH7223> governors<WH6346> who were before<WH6440> me were supported<WH3513> by the people,<WH5971> and took<WH3947> bread<WH3899> and wine<WH3196> from them,<WH310> besides forty<WH705> shekels<WH8255> of silver;<WH3701> yes,<WH1571> even their servants<WH5288> ruled<WH7980> over the people:<WH5971> but I didn't<WH6213> do so,<WH6440> because of the fear<WH3374> of God.<WH430>
Yes,<WH2388> also I continued in the work<WH4399> of this wall,<WH2346> neither bought<WH7069> we any land:<WH7704> and all my servants<WH5288> were gathered<WH6908> there to the work.<WH4399>

Moreover there were at my table,<WH7979> of the Jews<WH3064> and the rulers,<WH5461> one hundred<WH3967> fifty<WH2572> men,<WH935> besides those who came to us from among the nations<WH1471> that were around us.<WH5439>

Now that which was prepared<WH6213> for one day<WH3117> was one<WH259> ox<WH7794> and six<WH8337> choice<WH1305> sheep;<WH6629> also fowls<WH6833> were prepared<WH6213> for me,<WH6235> and once in ten days<WH3117> store<WH7235> of all sorts of wine:<WH3196> yet for all<WH5973> this I didn't<WH1245> demand the bread<WH3899> of the governor,<WH6346> because the bondage<WH5656> was heavy<WH3513> on this people.<WH5971>
Remember<WH2142> to me,<WH430> my God, for good,<WH2896> all that I have done<WH6213> for this people.<WH5971>
